revised_title: Davy's Experiments on Hyperoxymuriates and Chloric Acid
tldr: Humphry Davy studied the action of acids on hyperoxymuriates, focusing on the production of a new gas with bright yellowish-green color. This gas was found to be different from chlorine and had unique reactions with water and alkaline solutions. The author also discussed the possibility of the gas being a mixture with chlorine and the formation of hyperoxymuriates when mixed with alkaline solutions.
